macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Settle Mixed as Stronger Payrolls Reduce Fed Rate Cut Odds
items.summary: Major US indexes closed mixed on Wednesday: S&P 500 unchanged at a 2-week high, Dow down 0.13%, Nasdaq 100 up 0.29%. Stronger-than-expected January payrolls raised 10-year T-note yield to 4.17% and cut March FOMC rate cut chances to 6% from 23%.[3]

items.title: Nifty 50 Gains 0.07% Extending Rally, Eyes 26,000 Breakout
items.summary: India's Nifty 50 closed up 0.07% on February 11 in range-bound trade, marking four straight days of gains with higher highs/lows pattern. Support at 25,780; needs close above 26,000 for record high push amid bullish indicators.[1]

items.title: Bank Nifty Holds Strength Near Upper Bollinger Bands Despite Consolidation
items.summary: Bank Nifty traded range-bound with a small bullish candle, sustaining above prior gap and near upper Bollinger Bands. Momentum indicators show buy signals with RSI at 60.68, indicating underlying strength.[1]

items.title: Chip Stocks Lead Gains: Micron Surges Over 10% in Nasdaq Advance
items.summary: Micron Technology rose more than 10%, NXP Semiconductors and Microchip Technology up over 5%, boosting Nasdaq 100 amid AI infrastructure strength. This supported broader market despite mixed session.[3]

items.title: Key Earnings Reports Due February 12 Including Airbnb, Coinbase, Applied Materials
items.summary: Companies reporting earnings on February 12, 2026 include Airbnb (ABNB), Coinbase (COIN), Applied Materials (AMAT), Arista Networks (ANET), and others like Dexcom and American Electric Power.[3]

items.title: Indian Markets Eye Flat-to-Positive Open; Gift Nifty Up 0.13%, VIX Eases
items.summary: Gift Nifty signals mild positive start for Indian indices amid mixed European cues; India VIX down 1.05% to 11.5475. FIIs net buyers recently with DII support limiting downside.[4]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Hong Kong Allows Bitcoin and Ether as Margin Collateral
items.summary: Hong Kong's Securities and Futures Commission plans to permit Bitcoin and Ethereum as collateral for margin financing, alongside new rules for perpetual contracts and market-making on licensed platforms. The policy was unveiled at the Consensus 2026 conference on February 11.

items.title: BlockFills Halts Client Withdrawals Amid Bitcoin Downturn
items.summary: Chicago-based crypto liquidity provider BlockFills suspended client deposits and withdrawals due to a Bitcoin price downturn, following a 20% market drop last week. The halt is temporary, with trading still available.

items.title: Coinbase Earnings Preview Amid Bitcoin Selloff Concerns
items.summary: Coinbase is set to report earnings on February 12 with expected EPS of $1.15 on $1.96B revenue, facing worries from a Bitcoin selloff, JP Morgan downgrade, and weak trading volumes. Implied volatility suggests a potential 17% stock move.

items.title: Bitcoin Activity in Nancy Guthrie Ransom Case
items.summary: Bitcoin was reportedly sent to a wallet linked to a ransom note in the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, mother of 'Today' show host Savannah Guthrie. A new note demanded 1 BTC (~$70,000) for kidnapper information.

items.title: iShares Bitcoin ETP Issues 660,000 New Securities
items.summary: iShares Bitcoin ETP issued 660,000 new securities, set to begin trading on the London Stock Exchange main market on February 12, 2026.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Elon Musk's xAI Faces Internal Turmoil Amid Major Funding Rounds
items.summary: xAI is dealing with significant internal changes, while investors pour funds into multimodal AI capable of world models. Other developments include India's deepfake removal mandate effective February 20, Boston Dynamics CEO stepping down, and Cloudflare's AI-driven sales surge.

items.title: Transformer-Based AI Achieves Highly Accurate Battery Health Diagnostics
items.summary: Researchers at UNIST developed a configuration-agnostic AI model using transformers that identifies key health indicators for lithium-ion batteries, reducing prediction error to 1.90×10⁻² from 6.31×10⁻². The model promises applications in EVs, energy storage, and recycling.

items.title: University of Bayreuth AI Method Speeds Up Liquid Simulations
items.summary: A new neural network learns the universal density functional of liquids, enabling accurate prediction of chemical potentials without direct training. This physics-informed AI accelerates simulations for soft matter systems.

items.title: Geo Week 2026 Highlights AI for US Infrastructure Management
items.summary: Geo Week conference on February 16-18 will showcase AI-powered geospatial analytics for predictive infrastructure maintenance, including asset inventory and bridge failure prediction amid America's $1 trillion aging infrastructure crisis.

items.title: AI Magazine Features Thales CAIO on Frugal AI and Quantum Computing
items.summary: Latest AI Magazine issue spotlights Ajay Chakravarthy, CAIO at Thales, discussing frugal AI, quantum computing, and human-machine teaming.

items.title: Reports Emerge of Botched Surgeries as AI Enters Operating Rooms
items.summary: As AI integrates into surgical procedures, incidents of botched surgeries and misidentified body parts are being reported, raising concerns over reliability.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Scheduled for February 12 with Major Game Reveals
items.summary: Sony announced a PlayStation State of Play livestream on Thursday, February 12, 2026, at 2:00 P.M. PT / 5:00 P.M. ET, featuring over 60 minutes of reveals and updates. Expected highlights include a potential release date for Marvel’s Wolverine and updates on Marathon, Control Resonant, Phantom Blade Zero, and Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds.

items.title: 1200 Ubisoft Workers Strike Over Restructuring
items.summary: Approximately 1200 Ubisoft employees, primarily in France and Milan, are striking from February 10 to 12, 2026, in response to recent company restructuring.

items.title: Circana Forecasts 3% Rise in U.S. Video Game Spending to $62.8B in 2026
items.summary: Analyst firm Circana projects U.S. video game industry spending will increase 3% to $62.8 billion in 2026, exceeding the previous record of $61.7 billion from 2021.

items.title: PS Plus Extra and Premium Game Catalog Additions Announced for February 2026
items.summary: PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium subscribers have new Game Catalog titles available for February 2026.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Microsoft Plans Data Center Redesign with High-Temperature Superconductors
items.summary: Microsoft announced plans to rewire its data centers using high-temperature superconductors (HTS) to reduce power consumption, space needs, and backlash over energy demands. The initiative includes HTS cables inside and outside data centers, following a partnership with President Trump to control electricity costs.

items.title: Marushika Technology Limited Opens IPO for Data Center and Cybersecurity Solutions
items.summary: Marushika Technology, a provider of data center cybersecurity and IT infrastructure for government and PSU clients, launched its IPO on February 12, 2026. Proceeds will strengthen its balance sheet and support growth amid India's digital transformation.

items.title: Tyler Technologies Schedules Q4 2025 Earnings Call and Announces $1 Billion Share Repurchase
items.summary: Tyler Technologies, a leader in government technology software, will hold its Q4 2025 earnings conference call on February 12, 2026, and announced a $1 billion share repurchase plan. The company also plans to acquire For The Record.
